jsky.science
Class Passband

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jsky.science.AbstractScienceObject
        |
        +--jsky.science.AbstractScienceObjectNode
              |
              +--jsky.science.Passband
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, ReplaceablePropertyChangeListener, ScienceObjectModel, ScienceObjectNodeModel, java.io.Serializable
public class Passband
extends AbstractScienceObjectNode

Passband class provides support for range of wavelengths. Including a static list of standard passbands (U B V for example). Wavelengths are stored internally in nanometers as double values

This code was developed by NASA, Goddard Space Flight Center, Code 588 for the Scientist's Expert Assistant (SEA) project for Next Generation Space Telescope (NGST).

See Also:
Serialized Form

Passband

public Passband(java.lang.String val)
         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
constructs Passband from a string specifying the range in nanometers
Parameters:
val - String containing the range in the form "low-high" or "low" The middle is set to the average of the low and high. If only a low is specified, middle and high values are set to the low value
Throws:
java.lang.NumberFormatException - if it finds invalid numbers

getStdBands

public static java.lang.String[] getStdBands()
returns String array containing the names of the defined standard passbands

getStandardBroadBands

public static java.lang.String[] getStandardBroadBands()
returns Vector of strings of the "broad" bands. defined arbitrarily as the bands that have a single letter name (eg U or V)

setStdBands

public static void setStdBands(java.lang.String[] bands)
Resets the standard pass band list, parses in element of string assuming each element specifies a "low-high" format

getStandardPassband

public static Passband getStandardPassband(java.lang.String pName)
looks for the named passband in the list of standard bands and returns the Passband object. Returns null if bandname is not found
